template.title: NLP for Requirements Engineering (NLP4RE)
template.description: Template for analyzing Natural Language Processing approaches applied to Requirements Engineering tasks. This template organizes scientific data about NLP4RE methods, evaluation metrics, datasets, and annotation processes.

questions.title: Top-3 Most Frequently Used Evaluation Metrics

chartSettings.heading: Top-3 Most Frequently Used Evaluation Metrics in NLP Approaches

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What are top-3 most frequently used evaluation metrics to assess a developed NLP approach?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to know the established evaluation metrics so that I can assess my own NLP4RE approach according to the state-of-the-art metrics. (Asked by: Oliver Karras, Related ID Card: VII.1)

questions.title: Papers with Annotation Guidelines (by Year)

chartSettings.heading: Papers with Annotation Guidelines â€” papers per year

dataAnalysisInformation.question: Which papers are associated with annotation guidelines (distribution by year)?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to understand the annotation process so that I can reuse it to replicate dataset creation. (Asked by: Sallam Abualhaija, Related ID Card: V.6)

questions.title: Input Granularity and RE Tasks

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What are the different levels of granularity at which inputs can be represented and how is this related to the RE task?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a developer, I want to work at the right level of granularity so that I can accurately compare my method against existing ones. (Asked by: Sallam Abualhaija, Related ID Card: III.1 and I.1)

questions.title: Types of Baselines

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What are the types of baselines reported in the papers?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a reviewer, I want to be able to position the paper against existing work so that I can make a more informed decision. (Asked by: Sallam Abualhaija, Related ID Card: VII.3)

questions.title: Format of Textual Requirements

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What is the most common format of textual requirements?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to collect diverse requirements so that I validate the generalizability of my proposed method. (Asked by: Sallam Abualhaija, Related ID Card: IV.5)

questions.title: Dataset Quality Validation

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What is the state of practice for validating the quality of the annotated datasets?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to ensure that available datasets are of good quality so that I can reuse them in my research. (Asked by: Sallam Abualhaija, Related ID Card: V.9)

questions.title: Available Datasets for NLP4RE Tasks

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What datasets exist for a certain NLP4RE task?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to find all datasets for a certain NLP4RE task so that I can make a selection for my next paper. (Asked by: Fabiano Dalpiaz, Related ID Card: II.1 and IV)

questions.title: RE and NLP Task Combinations

dataAnalysisInformation.question: Which combinations of RE and NLP tasks are most (a)typical?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to identify over- and under-explored tasks so that I can direct my research line. (Asked by: Fabiano Dalpiaz, Related ID Card: I.1 and II.1)

questions.title: Missing ID Card Information

dataAnalysisInformation.question: Which ID-card informational elements do not provide enough options to respondents?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As an ID card manager, I want to identify emerging research topics so that I can update the ID card options offered to respondents according to the state of the art. (Asked by: Xavier Franch, Affects: all ID card questions)

questions.title: Annotator Numbers by Study Type

dataAnalysisInformation.question: What are the usual numbers of annotators for a given type of study?
dataAnalysisInformation.requiredDataForAnalysis: As a researcher, I want to have an idea of how many annotators to recruit based on state of art so that I can estimate how expensive/feasible is a study. (Asked by: Davide Fucci, Related ID Card: V.1-V.4)

notes: This template focuses on NLP4RE research contributions.
Data processing functions referenced in chartSettings need to be mapped from data_processing_helper_functions_nlp4re.ts
SPARQL queries use ORKG predicates and classes specific to the NLP4RE template (orkgc:C121001)
All SPARQL queries require the ORKG prefixes to be defined
